msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

DataGroup/Group split work.  DataGroup is for holding data items that may require item rendering. Group only holds visual items now.  The Group APIs stay the same (numItems, addItem, etc...).  DataGroup uses the IList APIs through its dataProvider.  So the equivalent methods are now dataProvider.length, dataProvider, addItem, etc...  This is just the initial split work as there's more to come to get the files up to spec.  We will also have to visit how we deal with graphic elements in DataGroup vs. Group.  For now the implementations are roughly the same.
QE: Yes - tests may break.  please update them.

- Added HGroup and VGroup wrappers for Group+Horizontal,VerticalLayout.
- Removed the provisional support for specifying layout with a
classname string.  The type of the layout property in Group
and in ItemsComponent is now ILayout.
More about the rationale for this change here:
Now, one must either use HGroup,VGroup or an explicit layout tag.
This change will affect most MXML files.  Upgrading is pretty easy.
The Panel and Application classes, whose default layout is BasicLayout,
have to be upgraded with an additional layout element, as in the
Substantially revised ScrollerSkin's measure and updateDisplayList
methods. The latter now calls invalidateSize (on itself!) if the
visibility of either scrollbar changes.  This causes the measure
method to compute new values for measuredWidth,Height based on the new
visibility state for the scrollbars.  When the scroll policy is "auto"
the Scroller's measured size includes space for the visible
Note also: the logic for calling updateDisplayList and then restarting
the process if the component has become invalid is in
- Removed the protected Group invalidateSizeAndLayout() method.

SDK-16782 -  ScrollBars overlap content in Scroller
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Initial checkin of the deferred instantiation feature for Gumbo.
ItemsComponent has a "creationPolicy" property that controls when the content items are created. Possible values are:
* "all" - content is created as soon as the ItemsComponent is created
* "auto" - content is created as soon as it is needed
* "none" - content is not automatically created. When this creationPolicy is set, you must call createDeferredContent().
The "contentCreationComplete" event is sent when the content has been created.
Added IDeferredContentOwner interface. ItemsComponent is the only Gumbo component that implements this interface.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Partial commit of the "Group as Viewport" feature.  Enables
simple scrolling for Groups with VerticalLayout.
They're default 0 and they're mapped to the origin of the Group's
scrollRect.  Added Number type contentWidth,Height properties.
Changed the layout property type and implementation.  The type is now
Object (was Class) to allow one to specify one of the predefined
layout class names, or a layout instance.
named using the (string class name valued) layout attribute.
Changed the type of the layout property to Object to match the
Replaced private static GAP:int constant with a similar "gap"
property.  Gap is the vertical space between rows, default is 6.
Added a rowCount:int property and a protected explicitRowCount var.
The rowCount property specifies the number of visible rows, which
implies the layoutTarget's height.  The default is -1 which means
that all rows should be visible.
Added rowHeight:Number and colWidth:Number properties, along with
their protected explicitFoo counterparts.  Currently unused.
Changed the measure function: if rowCount wasn't explicitly set
to -1, then the layoutTarget's height is the height of the first
rowCount items (plus the gap).  The layoutTarget's contentHeight
is set to the items' total height.
Changed the updateDisplayList function to set the scrollRect

SDK-16273 - Items added to ItemsComponent do not display

Implemented a temporary solution for tooling support. I create a temporary Group to capture the content API changes made before the actual contentGroup has been created. This needs to get reworked in a more general change to better handle dynamic usage of the content API.
